data.name: M Heracross-EX

attacks.text: This attack does 180 damage minus 10 damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

data.name: Torterra LV.X
rules: Put this card onto your Active Torterra. Torterra LV.X can use any attack, Poké-Power, or Poké-Body from its previous level.

abilities.name: Forest Murmurs
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if you have more Prize cards left than your opponent, you may choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and switch it with 1 of the Defending Pokémon. This power can't be used if Torterra is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Vigorous Dash
attacks.text: Does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Torterra does 30 damage to itself.

data.name: Skitty

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: It shows its cute side by chasing its own tail until it gets dizzy.

data.name: Umbreon

attacks.name: Retaliate
attacks.text: If any of your Pokémon were Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack during their last turn, this attack does 90 more damage.

data.flavorText: With its black fur, it blends into the darkness. It bides its time, and when prey appears, this Pokémon goes for its threat, and then eats it.

data.name: Armor Fossil
rules: Play Armor Fossil as if it were a Colorless Basic Pokémon. (Armor Fossil counts as a Trainer card as well, but if Armor Fossil is Knocked Out, this counts as a Knocked Out Pokémon.) Armor Fossil can't be affected by any Special Conditions and can't retreat. At any time during your turn before your attack, you may discard Armor Fossil from play. (This doesn't count as a Knocked Out Pokémon.)

abilities.name: Armor Stone
abilities.text: Whenever Armor Fossil would be damaged by your opponent's attack, flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, reduce that damage by 10.

data.name: Impidimp
data.flavorText: Through its nose, it sucks in the emanations produced by people and Pokémon when they feel annoyed. It thrives off this negative energy.

data.name: Dodrio

abilities.name: Retreat Aid
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, your Active Pokémon's Retreat Cost is ColorlessColorless less.

attacks.name: Fury Attack
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: An odd species that is rarely found. The three heads respectively represent joy, sadness, and anger.

data.name: Skorupi

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.flavorText: It attacks using the claws on its tail. Once locked in its grip, its prey is unable to move as this Pokémon's poison seeps in.

data.name: Switch
rules: Switch 1 of your Benched Pokémon with your Active Pokémon.

data.name: Florges-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Lead

attacks.name: Bright Garden
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage times the number of Grass Pokémon and Fairy Pokémon you have in play.

data.name: Arceus

attacks.name: Type Switch
attacks.text: Choose Grass, Fire, Water, Lightning, Psychic, Fighting, Darkness, Metal, Fairy, or Dragon type. Until the ends of your next turn, this Pokémon is that type.

attacks.name: Power Blast
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It is told in mythology that this Pokémon was born before the universe even existed.

data.name: Choice Band
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
The attacks of the Pokémon this card is attached to do 30 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon-GX or Active Pokémon-EX (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Kyogre Spirit Link
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
Your turn does not end if the Pokémon this card is attached to becomes Primal Kyogre-EX.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw 2 cards.

attacks.name: Tool Buster
attacks.text: Before doing damage, discard all Pokémon Tool cards from your opponent's Active Pokémon. If you discarded a Pokémon Tool card in this way, this attack does 70 more damage.

data.flavorText: The plant stalk it holds is its weapon. The stalk is used like a sword to cut all sorts of things.

data.name: Jirachi

abilities.name: Dreamy Revelation
abilities.text: Once during your turn, if this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, you may look at the top 2 cards of your deck and put 1 of them into your hand. Put the other card back on top of your deck.

attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 7 basic Energy cards and attach them to your Pokémon in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: Once every 1,000 years, the singing of a pure voice will rouse this Pokémon from its near-perpetual slumber. It wakes for only seven days.

abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for another Unown and switch it with Unown. (Any cards attached to Unown, damage counters, Special Conditions, and effects on it are now on the new Pokémon.) If you do, put Unown on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward. You can't use more than 1 Shuffle Poké-Power each turn.

attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. If 1 of them is heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep. If 2 of them are heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused. If all of them are heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Lysandre Labs
rules: Pokémon Tool cards in play (both yours and your opponent's) have no effect.
This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.flavorText: A Pokémon that appears to be a plant. It captures unwary prey by dousing them with a toxic powder.

data.name: Giratina LV.X
rules: Put this card onto your Active Giratina. Giratina LV.X can use any attack, Poké-Power, or Poké-Body from its previous level.

abilities.name: Invisible Tentacles
abilities.text: Whenever your opponent's Pokémon tries to attack, your opponent discards 1 card from his or her hand. (If your opponent can't discard 1 card, your opponent's Pokémon can't attack.) You can't use more than 1 Invisible Tentacles Poké-Body each turn.

attacks.name: Darkness Lost
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) If any of your opponent's Pokémon would be Knocked Out by damage from this attack, put that Pokémon and all cards attached to it in the Lost Zone instead of discarding it.

data.name: Dawn Wings Necrozma

attacks.name: Gulf Stream
attacks.text: If you have exactly 6 Prize cards remaining, this attack does 20 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Sword of Dawn
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Lunala no longer has a will of its own. Now under the control of Necrozma, it continuously expels all of its energy.

data.name: Alakazam-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Kinesis
abilities.text: When you play M Alakazam-EX from your hand to evolve this Pokémon, before it evolves, you may put 2 damage counters on your opponent's Active Pokémon and 3 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Suppression
attacks.text: Put 3 damage counters on each of your opponent's Pokémon that has any Energy attached to it.

data.name: Tauros

attacks.name: Raging Herd
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each damage counter on all of your Tauros and Tauros-GX.

data.flavorText: They live in groups. The one with the longest, thickest, and most-scarred horns is the boss of the herd.

data.name: Excadrill

attacks.name: Rototiller
attacks.text: Shuffle 4 cards from your discard pile into your deck.

data.flavorText: It can help in tunnel construction. Its drill has evolved into steel strong enough to bore through iron plates.

data.name: Enhanced Hammer
rules: Discard a Special Energy from 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Nest Ball
rules: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Noctowl

attacks.name: High Flight
attacks.text: Each player reveals his or her hand. This attack does 20 damage times the number of Item cards revealed.

data.flavorText: When it needs to think, it rotates its head 180 degrees to sharpen its intellectual power.

data.name: Rayquaza-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Celestial Roar
attacks.text: Discard the top 3 cards of your deck. If any of those cards are Energy cards, attach them to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dragon Burst
attacks.text: Discard all basic Fire Energy or all basic Lightning Energy attached to this Pokémon. This attack does 60 damage times the number of Energy you discarded.

data.name: Xerosic
rules: Choose a Pokémon Tool or Special Energy card attached to a Pokémon in play (yours or your opponent's) and discard it.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Eternatus VMAX
rules: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Eternal Zone
abilities.text: If all of your Pokémon in play are Darkness type, you can have up to 8 Pokémon on your Bench, and you can't put non-Darkness Pokémon into play. (If this Ability stops working, discard Pokémon from your Bench until you have 5.)

attacks.name: Dread End
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage for each of your Darkness Pokémon in play.

data.name: Roselia

attacks.name: Spit Poison
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.flavorText: The more healthy the Roselia, the more pleasant its flowers' aroma. Its scent deeply relaxes people.

data.name: Palkia G LV.X
rules: Put this card onto your Active Palkia G. Palkia G LV.X can use any attack, Poké-Power, or Poké-Body from its previous level.

abilities.name: Lost Cyclone
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may use this power. Any player who has 4 or more Benched Pokémon chooses 3 of his or her Benched Pokémon. Put the other Benched Pokémon and all cards attached to them in the Lost Zone. (You choose your Pokémon first.) This power can't be used it Palkia G is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Hydro Shot
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy attached to Palkia G. Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 80 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Gyarados-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Draconic Disaster

attacks.name: Dread Storm-GX
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from each of your opponent's Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Dusk Mane Necrozma

attacks.name: Dusk Shot
attacks.text: This attack does 60 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon-GX or Pokémon-EX. This damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

attacks.name: Rusty Claws
attacks.text: If your opponent has exactly 1 Prize card remaining, this attack does 100 more damage.

data.flavorText: This is its form with it is devouring the light of Solgaleo. It pounces on its foes and then slashes them with the claws on its four limbs and back.

data.name: Toxicroak

abilities.name: More Poison
abilities.text: Put 2 more damage counters on your opponent's Poisoned Pokémon during Pokémon Checkup.

attacks.name: Poison Claws
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.flavorText: It bounces toward opponents and gouges them with poisonous claws. No more than a scratch is needed to knock out its adversaries.

attacks.name: Spore
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Spore Evolution
attacks.text: Search your deck for a card that evolves from Paras. Attach it to Paras. This counts as evolving Paras. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Archen

attacks.name: Endeavor
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 more damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: Once thought to be the ancestor of all bird Pokémon, some of the latest research suggests that may not be the case.

data.name: Aerodactyl

attacks.name: Supersonic
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Fossil Fangs

data.flavorText: Restored from DNA found in amber, this Pokémon exhibited ferocity that was greater than expected. Some casualties resulted.

data.name: Great Ball
rules: Look at the top 7 cards of your deck. You may reveal a Pokémon you find there and put it into your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Mysterious Treasure
rules: Discard a card from your hand. If you do, search your deck for a Psychic or Dragon Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Sandygast

attacks.name: Astonish
attacks.text: Choose a random card from your opponent's hand. Your opponent reveals that card and shuffles it into their deck.

data.flavorText: It likes the shovel on its head, so Sandygast will get serious and fight any children who come to take it back.

data.name: M Alakazam-EX
rules: Mega Evolution rule: When 1 of your Pokémon becomes a Mega Evolution Pokémon, your turn ends.
Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Zen Force
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each damage counter on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Linear Attack

attacks.name: Destructor Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.flavorText: This Pokémon existed 300 million years ago. Team Plasma altered it and attached a cannon to its back.

data.name: Roller Skates
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, draw 3 cards.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

attacks.name: Drill Run
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It's not uncommon for tunnels that appear to have formed naturally to actually be a result of Excadrill's rampant digging.

data.name: Yanma

attacks.name: U-turn
attacks.text: Switch Yanma with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of an attack, including damage, done to Yanma during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: Its eyes can see 360 degrees without moving its head. It won't miss prey—even those behind it.

attacks.name: Sleep Bubble
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Doubleslap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

abilities.name: Shuffle
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for another Unown and switch it with Unown. (Any cards attached to Unown, damage counters, Special Conditions, and effects on it are now on the new Pokémon.) If you do, put Unown on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward. You can't use more than 1 Shuffle Poké-Power each turn.

attacks.name: Hidden Power
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Pokémon Tool cards and attach them to any of your Pokémon (excluding Pokémon that already have a Pokémon Tool attached to them). Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Galarian Meowth

abilities.name: Evolution Roar
abilities.text: You must discard 2 cards from your hand in order to use this Ability. Once during your turn, you may search your deck for a Galarian Perrserker, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: Living with a savage, seafaring people has toughened this Pokémon's body so much that parts of it have turned to iron.

data.name: Escape Rope
rules: Each player switches his or her Active Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon. (Your opponent switches first. If a player does not have a Benched Pokémon, he or she doesn't switch Pokémon.)
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Inkay

attacks.name: Perplex
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.flavorText: It draws prey near with its blinking lights and then wraps them up in its long tentacles and holds them in place.

data.name: Darkness Energy
rules: If the Pokémon Darkness Energy is attached to attacks, the attack does 10 more damage to the Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance). Ignore this effect if the Pokémon that Darkness Energy is attached to isn't Darkness. Darkness Energy provides Darkness Energy. (Doesn't count as a basic Energy card.)

data.name: Rare Candy
rules: Choose 1 of your Basic Pokémon in play. If you have a Stage 2 card in your hand that evolves from that Pokémon, put that card on the Basic Pokémon. (This counts as evolving that Pokémon.) You can't use this card during your first turn or on a Basic Pokémon that was put into play this turn.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Gyarados-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Mount Lanakila
rules: The Retreat Cost of each Basic Pokémon in play (both yours and your opponent's) is Colorless more.
This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

data.name: Acro Bike
rules: Look at the top 2 cards of your deck and put 1 of them into your hand. Discard the other card.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
The Retreat Cost of the Pokémon this card is attached to is Colorless less, and it can retreat even if it's Asleep or Paralyzed.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

rules: Discard a Special Energy from 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.

You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Teddiursa
data.flavorText: Before food becomes scarce in wintertime, its habit is to hoard food in many hidden locations.

attacks.text: Search your deck for a basic Energy card and attach it to this Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: It is said to be the guardian of the seas. It is rumored to have been seen on the night of a storm.

attacks.text: Discard the top 3 cards of your deck.

attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to each of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

rules: Mega Evolution rule: When 1 of your Pokémon becomes a Mega Evolution Pokémon, your turn ends.

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Sandshrew

data.name: Alolan Dugtrio

attacks.name: Digging Dash
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

data.flavorText: These Pokémon are cherished in the Alola region, where they are thought to be feminine deities of the land incarnate.

data.name: Field Blower
rules: Choose up to 2 in any combination of Pokémon Tool cards and Stadium cards in play (yours or your opponent's) and discard them.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Smeargle

abilities.name: Second Coat
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may switch a basic Energy card attached to your Active Pokémon with a different type of basic Energy card from your discard pile.

data.flavorText: Once it becomes an adult, it has a tendency to let its comrades plant footprints on its back.

attacks.name: Horn Grab
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed. If tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Super Slice
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If either of them is tails, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Ultra Space
rules: Once during each player's turn, that player may search their deck for an Ultra Beast card, reveal it, put it into their hand, and shuffle their deck.
This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

data.name: Buzzwole-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Jet Punch
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Knuckle Impact
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't attack during your next turn.

attacks.name: Absorption-GX
attacks.text: This attack does 40 damage for each of your remaining Prize cards. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Poké Ball
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Alolan Persian-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Smug Face
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon by your opponent's TAG TEAM Pokémon and Ultra Beasts, and by your opponent's Pokémon that have any Special Energy attached to them.

attacks.name: Stalking Claws-GX
attacks.text: This attack does 120 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, or any other effects on that Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Thievul

attacks.name: Thief
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals their hand. Choose a card you find there and put it on the bottom of their deck.

data.flavorText: It secretly marks potential targets with a scent. By following the scent, it stalks its targets and steals from them when they least expect it.

data.name: M Altaria-EX
rules: Mega Evolution rule: When 1 of your Pokémon becomes a Mega Evolution Pokémon, your turn ends.
Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Mist Purge
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any Special Energy attached to it, this attack does 30 more damage and heal 30 damage from each of your Pokémon.

data.name: Shaymin LV.X
rules: Put this card onto your Active Shaymin. Shaymin LV.X can use any attack, Poké-Power, or Poké-Body from its previous level.

abilities.name: Revenge Seed
abilities.text: If any of your Grass Pokémon were Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack during his or her last turn, each of Shaymin's attacks does 60 more damage to the Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Energy Flare
attacks.text: You may move any number of Energy cards attached to your Pokémon to your other Pokémon in any way you like.

data.name: Bill's Analysis
rules: Look at the top 7 cards of your deck. You may reveal up to 2 Trainer cards you find there and put them into your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Pokémon Catcher
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Buck's Training
rules: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.
Draw 2 cards. As long as Buck's Training is next to your Active Pokémon, each of your Active Pokémon's attacks does 10 more damage to the Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Dialga-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Chrono Wind
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is a Pokémon-EX, it can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Full Metal Impact
attacks.text: Discard 2 Metal Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Lucario & Melmetal-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Steel Fist
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Metal Energy card and attach it to this Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Full Metal Wall-GX
attacks.text: For the rest of this game, your Metal Pokémon take 30 less damage from your opponent's attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance). If this Pokémon has at least 1 extra Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), discard all Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Rough Seas
rules: Once during each player's turn, that player may heal 30 damage from each of his or her Water Pokémon and Lightning Pokémon.
This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

data.name: Shauna
rules: Shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, draw 5 cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Plumeria
rules: Discard 2 cards from your hand. If you do, discard an Energy from 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

attacks.name: Tumbling Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 more damage.

data.flavorText: This Pokémon's steel spikes are sheathed in ice. Stabs from these spikes cause deep wounds and severe frostbite as well.

data.name: Manaphy-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Aqua Tube

attacks.name: Mineral Pump
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from each of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Apricorn Maker
rules: Search your deck for up to 2 Item cards that have the word "Ball" in their name, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

attacks.name: Icy Wind

data.flavorText: A Pokémon that lives on icebergs. It swims in the sea using the point on its head to break up ice.

data.name: Scizor VMAX
rules: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Hard Scissors
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Ferrothorn

attacks.name: Swift Swing
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage for each Metal Energy attached to this Pokémon. Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: This Pokémon scrapes its spikes across rocks, and then uses the tips of its feelers to absorb the nutrients it finds within the stone.

data.name: Field Blower
rules: Choose up to 2 in any combination of Pokémon Tool cards and Stadium cards in play (yours or your opponent's) and discard them.

rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Combustion Blast
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't use Combustion Blast during your next turn.

data.name: Fire Memory
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
The Silvally-GX this card is attached to is a Fire Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

attacks.name: Bubble
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Continuous Bite
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. If you get 1 heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage. If you get 2 heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 30 more damage. If you get 3 heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 60 more damage.

data.name: Reuniclus

abilities.name: Damage Swap
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may move 1 damage counter from 1 of your Pokémon to another of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Psywave
attacks.text: Does 10 more damage for each Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

data.flavorText: This extremely rare Pokémon is a different color than usual. It is very hard to find.

data.name: Forretress

attacks.name: Thorny Eruption
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage for each heads to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Lost Blast
attacks.text: Put this Pokémon and all cards attached to it in the Lost Zone.

data.flavorText: It remains immovably rooted to its tree. It scatters piece of its hard shell to drive its enemies away.

data.name: Electivire LV.X
rules: Put this card onto your Active Electivire. Electivire LV.X can use any attack, Poké-Power, or Poké-Body from its previous level.

abilities.name: Shocking Tail
abilities.text: As long as Electivire is your Active Pokémon, whenever your opponent attaches an Energy card from his or her hand to 1 of his or her Pokémon, put 2 damage counters on that Pokémon.

attacks.name: Pulse Barrier
attacks.text: Discard all of your opponent's Pokémon Tool cards and Stadium cards in play. If you do, prevent all effects, including damage, done to Electivire during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Eviolite
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
If the Pokémon this card is attached to is a Basic Pokémon, any damage done to this Pokémon by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Audino

attacks.name: Relaxed Roll
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 damage times the number heads.

data.flavorText: Using the feelers on its ears, it can tell how someone is feeling or when an egg might hatch.

abilities.name: Shuffle
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for another Unown and switch it with Unown. (Any cards attached to Unown, damage counters, Special Conditions, and effects on it are now on the new Pokémon.) If you do, put Unown on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward. You can't use more than 1 Shuffle Poké-Power each turn.

attacks.name: Hidden Power
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, switch all damage counters on Unown with those on the Defending Pokémon. (If an effect of this attack is prevented, this attack does nothing.)

data.name: Scizor

attacks.name: Raid
attacks.text: If this Pokémon evolved from Scyther during this turn, this attack does 90 more damage.

attacks.name: Guard Claw
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: Once it has identified something as an enemy, it will continue beating them with its steel-hard pincers until there's nothing left but scraps.

data.name: Terrakion

attacks.name: Cavern Counter
attacks.text: If all of your Benched Pokémon have at least 1 damage counter on them, this attack does 150 more damage.

data.flavorText: Its charge is strong enough to break through a giant castle wall in one blow. This Pokémon is spoken of in legends.

data.name: Swablu

attacks.name: Bind Wound
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from 1 of your Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It constantly grooms its cotton-like wings. It takes a shower to clean itself if it becomes dirty.

attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon's Slash attack does 60 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: Living with a savage, seafaring people has toughened this Pokémon's body so much that parts of it have turned to iron.

rules: Heal 30 damage from 1 of your Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.flavorText: It chews its way through boulders with its sturdy jaws. Its eyes can see in the darkness underground.

data.name: Guzzlord-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Eat Sloppily
attacks.text: Discard the top 5 cards of your deck. If any of those cards are Energy cards, attach them to this Pokémon.

data.name: Hitmonchan
data.flavorText: The spirit of a pro boxer has infused this POKéMON. It throws punches that are faster than a bullet train.
